intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. perversum, commonly known as the devil's bit scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. This subspecies is known for its ornamental value and is often found in meadows and grassy areas.
